metadata.Title: CVE-2021-28375 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.11.6.fastrpc_internal_invoke in drivers/misc/fastrpc.c does not prevent userapplications from sending kernel RPC messages, aka CID-20c40794eb85. Thisis a related issue to CVE-2019-2308.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28375` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-73-generic - 5.4.0-73.82~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-73-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-73.82~18.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-73.82~18.04.1').
